This manual describes version &appletversion; of &applet;.
Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &applet; applet or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &applet; applet checks your mail server at regular intervals to determine if there is new mail in your mailbox. The applet displays a message to inform you whether you have new mail.

sect2.title: To Add &applet; to a Panel
sect2.para: To add &applet; to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose Add to Panel. Select &applet; in the Add to the panel dialog, then click OK.

sect1.title: Checking Your Mail
sect1.para: To check the mail server for new messages, right-click on the applet, then choose Update. &applet; contacts the mail server to determine if there is new mail on the server.

sect2.title: Changing Behavior
sect2.para: To change the behavior of &applet;, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences and select the Behavior tab.

varlistentry.term: To change time period between checks:

listitem.para: Use the Check for mail every ... minutes ... seconds spin boxes to specify how often &applet; checks the mail server to determine if there is new mail.

varlistentry.term: To have audible alert to new mail:

listitem.para: Select the Play a sound when new mail arrives option to play a default sound when the applet finds new mail on the mail server. The default sound file is specified in $prefix/etc/sound/events/mailcheck.soundlist.
If you select an animated image from the Select animation drop-down list, select the Stop animation when double clicked option to stop the animation when you double-click on the applet.
Use the Select animation drop-down list box to select the type of display to use in the applet. You can display text, an image, or an animation.

sect2.title: Changing Commands
sect2.para: To change the commands you can run from &applet;, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences and select the Behavior tab. Set commands to run at the following times:

listitem.para: Select this option to run a command before &applet; checks for new mail. Type the command in the text box provided. For example, type the command to run the dialup software that you use to connect to the Internet.

Select this option to run a command when &applet; detects new mail. Type the command in the text box provided. For example, type fetchmail to run the fetchmail program to retrieve mail from a remote mail server.

Select this option to run a command when you double-click on the &applet; applet. Type the command in the text box provided. For example, to start a Netscape Messenger window when you double-click on the applet, type netscape -mail in the text box.

sect1.title: Inbox Settings
sect1.para: To configure the inbox settings for &applet;, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences and select the Inbox tab.

listitem.para: Select one of the following options from the drop-down list box to specify the type of mail server on which your mailbox resides:
If your mailbox resides on a shared mail spool area on a local mail server.
If your mailbox is set up as a maildir mailbox that resides in your local directory tree.
If your mailbox resides on a remote Post Office Protocol 3 (POP3) mail server.
If your mailbox resides on a remote Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) server.

sect1.para: The different places your mail box resides will require different information from you. To following shows what needs to be filled out for different mailbox residences.

listitem.para: Use the Mail spool file field to specify the location to check for new messages.
Use the Mail server text box to specify the name of the remote mail server.
Use the Username text box to specify the username to access the remote mail server.
Use thePassword text box to specify the password to access the remote mail server.

Select the Save password to disk option to save the password in encrypted format in the gconf database. If you select this option, the applet does not prompt you to enter the password each time you want to access the mail server.
Use the Folder text box to specify the folder on the server that contains your mailbox.
